question: Which of the following is referred to as the "Golden age of Cricket"?
explanation: The period from 1890 to 1914 is referred to as the "Golden age of Cricket". The "Golden Age" of cricket is a term that has often been applied in cricket literature to the period in English cricket from 1890, the opening season of the official County Championship, to the outbreak of World War I which occurred just before the scheduled end of the 1914 season.
